New Records: Dawid Malan scored a career-best 140 runs for England in the match.
Reece Topley made his World Cup debut with 4 wickets for 49 runs.
England won by 137 runs, their biggest World Cup victory overseas.
Key Match Events: Sam Curran took 2 quick wickets of Taskin Ahmed to end Bangladesh's innings.
Litton Das and Mushfiqur Rahim formed a late partnership but couldn't turn the game around.
Towhid Hridoy's LBW review was a turning point in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and decided to field first.
Jonny Bairstow and Dawid Malan formed an aggressive opening partnership.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler praised Dawid Malan's performance and the team's resilience.
Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan admitted the early loss of wickets was costly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mark Wood's pace and accuracy were key factors in England's win.
Adil Rashid and Reece Topley's performances highlighted England's spin and seam options.
